column4: Do I need to have special drivers to allow the Feisty CD to boot if I have an ATI video card?
you shouldn't...
Thanks...  X won't display when I boot and try to install
can you get to a command line?
No
Laptop has Edgy on it now, and I could get to that one, but I want to do a clean install
what happens when you hit the key combo CTRL-ALT-F1 (or F1 thru F6....F7 will bring you back to default)
That's what I tried, nothing happens
hmmm...
If I change the F4-VGA to something unusual, I'll eventually get an Xserver crashed message
have you tried an alternate install CD?
interesting...
Not yet... never had an issue, was wondering if something were different about these.. Kubuntu herd installed on my other one without issue

so here's what I suggest then (if Kubuntu was able to install okay)...install Kubuntu Feisty from CD and then add the ubunt-desktop package (that will pull in Gnome, etc.)....see if that works for you
Okay...  otherwise I can do a normal upgrade via the upgrade-manager if I have to
Just that this'll be the third upgrade like that on this machine, and I wanted to start fresh
Thanks for the ideas
if you do an upgrade, then read the documentation that ubuntu.com has provided...it explains the correct process you should follow to upgrade successfully
sure! any time!
Yeah, about the same as the Dapper -> Edgy upgrade I did on it
Thanks again
